name: 丁原智
objective: This course focus on investigating the problems of the geotechnical engineering. Major topics of Advanced Geotechnical Engineering (II) consist of (1) Foundation engineering, (2) Engineering geology, (3) Soil & water conservation, and (4) Geotechnical reliability analysis.
schedule:
Week 1 Introduction
Week 2 (Vacation)
Week 3 Site investigation
Week 4 Lateral earth pressure
Week 5 Retaining wall design and bracing cut
Week 6 Slope stability
Week 7 (Vacation)
Week 8 Shallow foundation and Pile foundation
Week 9 Midterm exam
Week 10 The influence of geology to engineering
Week 11 The influence of geology to engineering
Week 12 Geophysical Methods
Week 13 Numerical analysis in geotechnical engineering
Week 14 Soil & water conservation
Week 15 Geotechnical reliability analysis
Week 16 Geotechnical reliability analysis
Week 17 (Vacation)
Week 18 Final exam
scorePolicy: Midterm exam (40%)、 Final exam (40%)、 Homework and attendance (20%)
materials:
1. Braja M. Das (2002), Principles of Geotechnical Engineering
2. Braja M. Das (2007), Principles of Foundation Engineering
3. Goodman R.E. (1989), Introduction to Rock Mechanics
4. Hoek, E. and Brown, E.T. (1981), Underground Excavations in Rock
5. Hoek, E. and Bray J. W. (1996), Rock Slope Engineering
